Residential Lighting Menu inputs: AEO2017 Reference case with no CPP subsidies
Last Modified: October 28, 2016
Definition:    Self-contained lighting technology and usage database for the RDM
Units:         See specific sections and headings below
Sources:       EIA - Technology Forecast Updates – Residential and Commercial Building Technologies
                   – Reference Case, EIA/Navigant, August 10, 2016;
               2009 RECS; 2010 U.S. Lighting Market Characteriztion, EERE Jan 2012;
               Residential Lighting End-Use Consumption Study: Estimation Framework and Initial Estimates,
                 EERE, Dec 2012;
               Solid-State Lighting Research and Development Multi-Year Program Plan, EERE, April 2013
Comments:      Current parameters allow 4 lighting applications with up to four bulb technologies in each
Notes:         Added dollar year of cost data to input file; adds EE rebates for historical EE calibration; changed beta 1 from -0.95 to -1.20 and beta 2 from -0.10 to -0.06







Dollar Year for Cost Data (RLGTDOLLARYR)
 2015

Number of Applications (NumApps) (i.e., GSL, reflector, linear fluorescent, exterior)
 4

Application Labels AppIDs()-Char*3 Data-and Order in Data File AppIndex()
GSL REF LFL EXT
 1   2   3   4 

Number of BulbType by Application (NumTypes); Number of usage bins (i.e., hours used) by application (NumAppBins) 
GSL REF LFL EXT
 3   4   3   4
 6   1   1   1

Technology Cost and Performance (years assumed not to overlap within an application bulb type)
(Note read this section until 9999 is encountered for FirstYear)
